entries.Definition: The most important job on a historical film, while ironically also being the flimsiest.
A person who creates wild surprises, resulting in exuberant cheers at SXSW premieres.
A potential terrorist threat who risks being held for questioning while on route to the Oscars.
Someone masterful at creating fake action for Hollywood and false statements before the Court.
The once glorious, now near-obsolete, defender of crazy kings, fair ladies and dirty secrets.
A freedom-hating motherfucker who will get what he deserves, right between the eyes!!
A living metaphor for someone who feins satisfaction but clearly lives an unfulfilled life.
A pop-punk sellout, usually living in both the past and his parent's basement.
A real-life behind-the-scenes version of The Piano Teacher.
Another hard-to identify corset-wearing character in a litterary adaption.
A master of deception who fudges facts but brags about replicating props in the final credits.
A position only required on the most overblown blockbuster franchises.
A real firecracker of a kid who grows up to burn brightly and brilliantly on the screen.
A local yocal who can find the oddest and most authentic people in America.
Not to be confused with a trigger-happy gun enthusiast, no matter what he looks like.
Undervalued artist who is maligned late in the production process over "creative differences".
Multi-talented individual who can masterfully move around images and numbers.
A patient artist prone to emotional breakdowns when nature destroys his cameras.
An unnessary component to a film where the images say more than washed up TV actors ever could.
A job every actor wants to try, even if it's for TV, and often to disastrous effect.
The person you ignore when making an epic and unprecedented genre-defying film.
The single most important part of an independent film set, capable of luring Oscar winners.
Someone with the power to, apparently, possess others into commiting rape.
A busy person during the Festival de Cannes, with guaranteed bookings from the Cronenbergs.
A predictor of the Gods who is unable to forecast bad remakes by powerful directors.
A true cowboy (usually with a name like "Rusty") who makes sure horses don't really blow up.
An insulting way to justify a project when subject wanted nothing to do with it.
Title assigned to stars who want to cozy up to handsome young actors for a few weeks.
Spineless number cruncher enabling Hollywood's most ridiculous and expensive decisions
Talented expert who applies war-paint to on-screen heroes, and may respond to letters.
Terribly jealous member of the crew who makes poor decisions to try and embarace actors.
Old-school movie job that can still shock and disgust audiences when done right.
Aerial adrenaline junkie who may also be addicted to alcohol and cocaine.
Unlikely asset who can make light and colourful comedies feel real and grounded.
Grainy, black and white video meant to fool viewers into being authentic film records.
Apparently, the laziest position in Hollywood.
Son-of-a-bitch hired to cut your throught the minute you say something stupid, you hear?
Indespensible artist who brings quality assurance to a potentially silly sports comedy.
A mountain of muscles incapable of forming proper grammatical sentences, but perfect for the part.
Somone ignored on film sets,  aunless it's lazy comedy with "Boom" in the title.
The temporary user of expensive toys from a director/writer/editor/star's personal collection
The object of desire by sweaty old masters of cinema, and basically every other living male.
A completely useless and hilarious position used to pad the budget on wild French art films.
Hollywood's true magicians who bring dinosaurs to life... or at least making them look younger.
The person who decides who lives and dies, within the context of a film.
Technician tasked with making ultra low-budget films look more important on the big screen.
Someone who assumes the essence of another person, usually only providing shades of the real thing.
Based on his or her previous successess, a person able to raise/mislead audience expectations.
